title: Why Lab Results Take Time
summary: A calm explanation of what happens between collection and a final result — and why delays don’t mean neglect.

title: Why Recollection Happens (And Why It’s Not About Blame)
summary: Hemolysis, contamination risk, specimen integrity — and why recollection is often the safest option.

title: What Reference Ranges Really Mean
summary: Reference ranges are population tools, not guarantees — and context changes interpretation.
